Package structure

Class Cell

java.lang.Object
structure.Cell
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, Empty, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Cell
extends java.lang.Object
This is the abstract class which is used as the unit on board[][]. Each piece, such as king, has their own movement rules. They have to extend the cell class and write the different move methods.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    java.lang.String cellName
    The cell's name, such as "##" or " ",which is under the piece.
    boolean isAlive
    The boolean value to show whether the piece is alive on the board.
    java.lang.String pieceName
    The piece's name, such as "wR" or "bR".
    int x
    The x-coordinate of the piece on the board.
    int y
    The y-coordinate of the piece on the board.

    Cell​(java.lang.String cellName, java.lang.String pieceName, boolean isAlive, int x, int y)
    Initialize the Cell object with cellName, pieceName, isAlive, x, y.

  • Constructor Details

    • Cell

      public Cell​(java.lang.String cellName, java.lang.String pieceName, boolean isAlive, int x, int y)
      Initialize the Cell object with cellName, pieceName, isAlive, x, y.
      Parameters:
      cellName - The cell's name, such as "##" or " ",which is under the piece.
      pieceName - The piece's real name, such as "wR" or "bR".
      isAlive - The boolean value to show whether the piece is alive on the board.
      x - The x-coordinate of the piece on the board.
      y - The y-coordinate of the piece on the board.

  • Method Details

    • move

      public abstract boolean move​(int currX, int currY, int tarX, int tarY)
      The abstract move method which should be override by subclass.
      Parameters:
      currX - The x-coordinate of starting point in the movement.
      currY - The y-coordinate of starting point in the movement.
      tarX - The x-coordinate of targeting point in the movement.
      tarY - The y-coordinate of targeting point in the movement.
      Returns:
      True if successfully move. Otherwise, return false.

    • Searcher

      public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Point> Searcher()
      The abstract Searcher method which should be override by subclass.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList contains all of the possible location of a piece can reach

    • jump

      public static void jump​(int currX, int currY, int tarX, int tarY)
      This method perform the exact movement from one position to another. It will put the override the targeting unit on the board and put an Empty object on the Starting position.
      Parameters:
      currX - The x-coordinate of starting point in the movement.
      currY - The y-coordinate of starting point in the movement.
      tarX - The x-coordinate of targeting point in the movement.
      tarY - The y-coordinate of targeting point in the movement.
